                                  byte[] write)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Saves byte array to the specified file in the app folder, encodes the bytes to Base64 before writing. The file will only be accessible to your app.
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename under which the data should be stored
        write - the data to be stored
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saveToSharedPrefBase64

        public void saveToSharedPrefBase64(java.lang.String spAlias,
                                   java.lang.String dataAlias,
                                   byte[] data)
        Saves data as Base64-encoded String in the app's SharedPreferences. Will only be accessible by your app.
        Parameters:
        spAlias - the alias under which the SharedPref is to be stored
        dataAlias - the alias of the data itself
        data - the data as byte array

      • loadFromSharedPrefBase64

        public byte[] loadFromSharedPrefBase64(java.lang.String spAlias,
                                       java.lang.String dataAlias)
                                throws CryptoIOHelper.DataNotAvailableException
        Reads the data saved under the specified alias. Data must have been saved Base64-encoded.
        Parameters:
        spAlias - the alias under which the SharePref was stored
        dataAlias - the alias of the data itself
        Returns:
        the data as byte array
        Throws:
        CryptoIOHelper.DataNotAvailableException

      • providerCheck

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> providerCheck()
        Method for Debugging Purposes. Checks which Cryptographic Providers are available on the present platform. Returns a LinkedList with the algorithms that are available on the present Platform.
